items.label: lem-os-gaussian-reflection-invariant
items.title: Gaussian Kernel is Reflection Invariant
items.content:
46: :label: lem-os-gaussian-reflection-invariant
47: 
48: The Gaussian interaction kernel used in companion selection:
49: 
50: $$
51: K(x, y) := \exp\left(-\frac{\|x - y\|^2}{2\sigma^2}\right)
52: $$
53: 
54: satisfies reflection invariance for any reflection operator $\theta_\mu$:
55: 
56: $$
57: K(\theta_\mu x, \theta_\mu y) = K(x, y)
58: $$

items.label: lem-os-psd-kernel-reflection-positive
items.title: Reflection Positivity from Positive Semidefinite Kernels
items.content:
121: :label: lem-os-psd-kernel-reflection-positive
122: 
123: Let $K: \mathbb{R}^4 \times \mathbb{R}^4 \to \mathbb{R}$ be a **positive semidefinite kernel**:
124: 
125: $$
126: \sum_{i,j=1}^{N} c_i \cdot K(x_i, x_j) \cdot c_j \geq 0 \quad \forall N \in \mathbb{N}, \, c_1, \ldots, c_N \in \mathbb{R}, \, x_1, \ldots, x_N \in \mathbb{R}^4
127: $$
128: 
129: Suppose $K$ is reflection-invariant: $K(\theta x, \theta y) = K(x, y)$ for the time reflection $\theta$.
130: 
131: Let $P$ be a Markov kernel on $\mathbb{R}^4$ constructed using $K$ (e.g., companion selection with Gaussian weights), and let $\pi$ be an invariant measure for $P$.
132: 
133: Then $\pi$ satisfies **reflection positivity**: for any test function $f \in \mathcal{S}(\mathcal{H}_+)$,
134: 
135: $$
136: \langle f, \theta f \rangle_\pi := \int_{\mathbb{R}^{4N}} f(\mathcal{S}) \cdot \overline{f(\theta \mathcal{S})} \, d\pi(\mathcal{S}) \geq 0
137: $$
items.raw_directive:
118: This is the key functional analysis result connecting kernel properties to measure properties.

items.label: lem-os-gaussian-exponential-decay
items.title: Gaussian Kernel Induces Exponential Clustering
items.content:
364: :label: lem-os-gaussian-exponential-decay
365: 
366: For walkers at positions $x, y \in \mathbb{R}^4$ with $\|x - y\| = r$, the companion interaction strength decays exponentially:
367: 
368: $$
369: K(x, y) = \exp\left(-\frac{r^2}{2\sigma^2}\right) \leq \exp\left(-\frac{r}{2\sigma}\right)
370: $$
371: 
372: for $r \geq \sigma$.
373: 
374: This establishes an **exponential suppression** with decay rate:
375: 
376: $$

items.content:

items.label: lem-os1-operators-covariant
items.title: Crystalline Gas Operators are Euclidean Covariant
items.content:
779: :label: lem-os1-operators-covariant
780: 
781: The three Crystalline Gas operators are **Euclidean covariant**:
782: 
783: 1. **Geometric ascent**: $\Psi_{\text{ascent}}(Rx) = R \cdot \Psi_{\text{ascent}}(x)$
784: 2. **Thermal fluctuation**: $\Psi_{\text{thermal}}(Rx) \overset{d}{=} R \cdot \Psi_{\text{thermal}}(x)$
785: 3. **Companion interaction**: Uses metric $d_{\mathcal{X}}(x, y) = \|x - y\|$, which is SO(4)-invariant
items.raw_directive:
